com.topcoder.clients.dao.ejb3
Class ClientDAOBean

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.clients.dao.ejb3.GenericEJB3DAO<com.topcoder.clients.model.Client,java.lang.Long>
      com.topcoder.clients.dao.ejb3.ClientDAOBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientDAO, ClientDAOLocal, ClientDAORemote, GenericDAO<com.topcoder.clients.model.Client,java.lang.Long>
public class ClientDAOBean
extends GenericEJB3DAO<com.topcoder.clients.model.Client,java.lang.Long>
implements ClientDAO, ClientDAOLocal, ClientDAORemote

This class is a Stateless Session Bean realization of the ClientDAO business interface.

This class has a default no-arg constructor.

This class implements the method available for the ClientDAO business interface: get the projects for the corresponding client.

See base class for other available operations.

It uses the EntityManager configured in the base class to perform the needed operations, retrieve the EntityManager using it's corresponding getter.

THREAD SAFETY: This class is technically mutable since the inherited configuration properties (with PersistenceContext ) are set after construction, but the container will not initialize the properties more than once for the session beans and the EJB3 container ensure the thread safety in this case.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mafy, TCSDEVELOPER

Method Detail

getProjectsForClient

public java.util.List<com.topcoder.clients.model.Project> getProjectsForClient(com.topcoder.clients.model.Client client)
                                                                        throws DAOException

Performs the retrieval of the list with projects with the given client from the persistence. If nothing is found, return an empty list. Return only the entities that are not marked as deleted.

Specified by:
getProjectsForClient in interface ClientDAO
Parameters:
client - the given clients to retrieve it's projects. Should not be null.
Returns:
the list of Projects for the given client found in the persistence. If nothing is found, return an empty list.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if client is null.
EntityNotFoundException - if client is not found in the persistence.
DAOConfigurationException - if the configured entityManager is invalid (invalid means null here).
DAOException - if any error occurs while performing this operation.
